title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability benefits. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding disability insurance benefits, eliminating the waiting period from the determination of benefit amount. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability benefits and makes amendments to the Social Security Act regarding disability insurance benefits. This includes eliminating defined terms and making conforming amendments to certain sections of the Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability benefits and amends the Social Security Act regarding disability insurance benefits, including changes to widow's insurance benefits based on disability. Amendments involve eliminating defined terms and making conforming changes to specific sections of the Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability benefits and makes amendments to widow's insurance benefits based on disability. Amendments involve eliminating defined terms and making conforming changes to specific sections of the Act. Specifically, the Act is amended by redesignating paragraphs and eliminating defined terms related to disability insurance benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes waiting periods for disability benefits under the Social Security Act and Medicare disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes waiting periods for disability benefits under the Social Security Act and Medicare disability benefits. Section 226(b) of the Social Security Act is amended to remove specific time requirements for entitlement to benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes waiting periods for disability benefits under the Social Security Act and Medicare. Section 226(b) is amended to remove specific time requirements for entitlement to benefits. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act and Medicare to reflect these changes. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove specific time requirements for entitlement to an annuity. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove specific time requirements for entitlement to an annuity. Effective dates are outlined in Section 5. The amendments made by this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability and entitlement to benefits under specific sections of the Social Security Act, with effective dates outlined for each provision. Section 3 of the Act applies to disability determinations filed under title II of the Social Security Act, while Section 4 applies to insurance benefits under title XVIII for items and services furnished at least 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
